abstract.text: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.

inlineContent.text: This operator works with an upstream publisher of publishers, flattening the stream of elements to appear as if they were coming from a single stream of elements. It switches the inner publisher as new ones arrive but keeps the outer publisher constant for downstream subscribers.
For example, given the type
, calling
results in the type
. The downstream subscriber sees a continuous stream of
elements from what looks like a single
even though the elements are coming from different upstream publishers.

When this operator receives a new publisher from the upstream publisher, it cancels its previous subscription. Use this feature to prevent earlier publishers from performing unnecessary work, such as creating network request publishers from frequently updating user interface publishers.
The following example updates a
with a new value every
seconds. A
operator receives the new value and uses it to create a new
. By using the
operator, the downstream sink subscriber receives the
output type from the data task publishers, rather than the
type produced by the
operator. Furthermore, creating each new data task publisher cancels the previous data task publisher.

code: guard let url = response.url else { print("Bad response."); return }

inlineContent.text: The exact behavior of this example depends on the value of
and the speed of the network connection. If the delay value is longer, or the network connection is fast, the earlier data tasks may complete before
can cancel them. If this happens, the output includes multiple URLs whose tasks complete before cancellation.

abstract.text: Customize handling of asynchronous events by combining event-processing operators.
A subject that broadcasts elements to downstream subscribers.
Declares that a type can transmit a sequence of values over time.
The kind of values published by this publisher.
Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.

Transforms all elements from the upstream publisher with a provided closure.
Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.

A namespace for types that serve as publishers.
A publisher that flattens nested publishers.
A publisher that delivers the results of performing URL session data tasks.
